name: Ext_R4_RiskEvidenceSynthesis
title: Cross-version Extension for R4.RiskEvidenceSynthesis for use in FHIR R4B
description: This cross-version extension represents RiskEvidenceSynthesis from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/RiskEvidenceSynthesis|4.0.1 for use in FHIR R4B.

element.short: A quantified estimate of risk based on a body of evidence
element.definition: The RiskEvidenceSynthesis resource describes the likelihood of an outcome in a population plus exposure state where the risk estimate is derived from a combination of research studies.

element.short: Canonical identifier for this risk evidence synthesis, represented as a URI (globally unique)
element.definition: An absolute URI that is used to identify this risk evidence synthesis when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which at which an authoritative instance of this risk evidence synthesis is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the risk evidence synthesis is stored on different servers.

element.short: Canonical identifier for this risk evidence synthesis, represented as a URI (globally unique)
element.definition: An absolute URI that is used to identify this risk evidence synthesis when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which at which an authoritative instance of this risk evidence synthesis is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the risk evidence synthesis is stored on different servers.

element.short: Business version of the risk evidence synthesis
element.definition: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the risk evidence synthesis when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the risk evidence synthesis author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.

element.short: Business version of the risk evidence synthesis
element.definition: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the risk evidence synthesis when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the risk evidence synthesis author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.

element.short: Name for this risk evidence synthesis (computer friendly)
element.definition: A natural language name identifying the risk evidence synthesis. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

element.short: Name for this risk evidence synthesis (computer friendly)
element.definition: A natural language name identifying the risk evidence synthesis. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

element.short: Name for this risk evidence synthesis (human friendly)
element.definition: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the risk evidence synthesis.

element.short: Name for this risk evidence synthesis (human friendly)

The status of this risk evidence synthesis. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.
The status of this risk evidence synthesis. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

binding.description: The lifecycle status of an artifact.

element.definition: The date  (and optionally time) when the risk evidence synthesis was published. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the risk evidence synthesis changes.

The date  (and optionally time) when the risk evidence synthesis was published. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the risk evidence synthesis changes.

element.short: Name of the publisher (organization or individual)
element.definition: The name of the organization or individual that published the risk evidence synthesis.

element.short: Natural language description of the risk evidence synthesis
element.definition: A free text natural language description of the risk evidence synthesis from a consumer's perspective.

element.definition: A human-readable string to clarify or explain concepts about the resource.

element.short: The context that the content is intended to support
element.definition: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate risk evidence synthesis instances.

element.short: Intended jurisdiction for risk evidence synthesis (if applicable)
element.definition: A legal or geographic region in which the risk evidence synthesis is intended to be used.

element.short: Intended jurisdiction for risk evidence synthesis (if applicable)

binding.description: Countries and regions within which this artifact is targeted for use.

element.definition: A copyright statement relating to the risk evidence synthesis and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the risk evidence synthesis.

element.short: When the risk evidence synthesis was approved by publisher
element.definition: The date on which the resource content was approved by the publisher. Approval happens once when the content is officially approved for usage.

element.short: When the risk evidence synthesis was approved by publisher

element.short: When the risk evidence synthesis was last reviewed
element.definition: The date on which the resource content was last reviewed. Review happens periodically after approval but does not change the original approval date.

element.short: When the risk evidence synthesis is expected to be used

element.short: The category of the EffectEvidenceSynthesis, such as Education, Treatment, Assessment, etc.
element.definition: Descriptive topics related to the content of the RiskEvidenceSynthesis. Topics provide a high-level categorization grouping types of EffectEvidenceSynthesiss that can be useful for filtering and searching.

binding.description: The quality of the evidence described. The code system used specifies the quality scale used to grade this evidence source while the code specifies the actual quality score (represented as a coded value) associated with the evidence.
